intro: Anthostema senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese anthostema, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Anthostema senegalense is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks.
